text: Norman Thaddeus Vane (July 7, 1928 â€“ May 2, 2015) was an American screenwriter, producer, playwright and movie director. He served as writer for the 1968 movie Mrs. Brown, You've Got a Lovely Daughter. Later he was writer and associate producer of the movie Lola. He wrote the screenplay for the 1972 movie, 1931: Once Upon a Time in New York. Vane went on to direct the 1983 movie, Frightmare.
